Title: Strategy, Insight & Analytics Intern
Description:
About The Job

For our Strategy & Insight team in Milan we are looking as of now for a Strategy, Insight & Analytics Intern.

During your internship you‚Äôll be part of a dynamic team and you‚Äôll have visibility on all the company‚Äôs departments and you‚Äôll contribute to the achievements of your team.

About The Job

You‚Äôll collaborate with several company‚Äôs departments (Sales, Trade Marketing & Category, Marketing and Supply Chain) to develop your analytical skills and to discover competitive dynamics of fresh dairy products‚Äô market.

In details, you‚Äôll be involved on


Critical analysis to understand the market‚Äôs dynamics and competitors;
Sales and market trends analysis and consumers‚Äô behavior analysis (based on IRI database);
Support on projects based on qualitative and quantitative researches;
Management of relationships with analysis agencies and stakeholders;


About you

To be able to achieve the above and be successful in this role, we believe you need to have


Master‚Äôs degree in Economics or Marketing or Management Engineering;
Problem solving and entrepreneurial thinking;
Structured and analytical way of working;
Relational skills and flexibility;
Previous international and/or internship experience will be a plus;
Excel and Power Point knowledge;
Fluent in English.


About Us

About us

As a world leading food company DANONE stands for international success. Around 104000 employees work on all five continents in the three Danone business areas Essential Dairy & Plant-Based, Specialized Nutrition and Water on one corporate mission ‚ÄúBringing health through food to as many people as possible‚Äù.

We want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people must impact the world through their daily choices. Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in. We believe a healthy body needs healthy food and healthy food needs a healthy planet this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.

Do things your way. The way you work, the way you develop, the way you progress, it‚Äôs all up to you.

Working here you‚Äôll need to enjoy a fast-pace, complexity and it can get a little challenging. But it‚Äôs packed with opportunities. You‚Äôll work with some of the best-known brands in the world and we absolutely guarantee that you can just be yourself.

Be innovative and entrepreneurial and the impact you could make might just amaze you. Join our movement for a healthier world. One Planet One Health BY YOU.

We offer

We believe in a ‚ÄúPhygital‚Äù workplace.

Physical because our offices are centrally located and easily reached by public transportation. Free water, yogurt and fruits are of course benefits for our employees.

Digital as we work for objectives, without time or space constraints, in a responsible, autonomous and flexible way that helps to reconcile life and work times, improving productivity and focusing on results.

We offer you a culture, where you‚Äôll be welcomed to bring in ideas and take initiative. You‚Äôll learn from colleagues highly committed and passionate about what they do. We believe in learning something new each day as it means you keep growing every day!

We believe everyone has talent, something which comes natural to you. Your uniqueness is something which brings both excellence as well as energizes you.

In Italy we are Certified Great Place to Work and B Corp.

Inclusive Diversity

Danone is committed to create and live an inclusive & diverse environment, which will drive our growth as a business, as teams, as members of communities & as individuals. Valuing diversity is recognizing and respecting human differences and similarities. Our aim is to ensure that all employees and applicants are given equal opportunity and that our organization is representative of our consumers and society.

We commit to foster an inclusive working environment where we celebrate all types of diversity, both visible and invisible, which includes age, race, gender, nationality, disability, background, education, religion, beliefs, thinking style, perspectives and sexual orientation.

We believe that our differences will make the difference.

Your personal data will be processed in compliance with the EU Regulation 2016/679.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006 ed √® aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso.

Chi cerchiamo

Per quale Business Unit

L‚Äôattivit√† della Business Unit Generazione e Trading √® relativa alla gestione del portafoglio impianti di generazione del Gruppo con il duplice scopo di massimizzare la disponibilit√† e l‚Äôefficienza degli impianti, minimizzando i costi di esercizio e manutenzione (O&M) e di massimizzare il profitto derivante dalla gestione del portafoglio energetico attraverso l‚Äôattivit√† di compravendita di energia elettrica, di combustibili (gassosi e non gassosi) e di titoli ambientali sui mercati all‚Äôingrosso nazionali ed esteri. Rientra nell‚Äôambito della Business Unit anche l‚Äôattivit√† di trading sui mercati nazionali ed esteri di tutte le commodity energetiche (gas, energia elettrica, titoli ambientali).

Ti occuperai di


Gestire il processo di apertura e monitoraggio delle Richieste di Acquisto per servizi di fornitura dati e servizi
Interfacciarsi con il Business per la raccolta delle esigenze e degli input necessari
Relazionarsi con i Fornitori per la richiesta e negoziazione delle offerte economiche e per la gestione degli aspetti contrattuali

Collaborare con gli Uffici coinvolti nel processo di acquisto per l‚Äôavvio e la finalizzazione dei contratti, coinvolgendo il team Legal in caso di negoziazioni contrattuali
Gestire l‚Äôapprovazione periodica delle fatture¬†
Gestire le attivit√† di budgeting e di consuntivazione
Supportare le attivit√† di Data Quality e Data Remediation

Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese

Attitudine al problem solving e capacit√† di lavorare in autonomia e in team

Flessibilit√†:¬†settimana lavorativa con venerd√¨ a orario ridotto, flessibilit√† negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; Smartworking sino al 60% dell‚Äôorario di lavoro su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici

Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver,¬†offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti,¬†gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro:¬†promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche.   • Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
  • Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti, gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
  • Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
  • Ambiente di lavoro: promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale.


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull‚Äôetica e sulle pari opportunit√† garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversit√†.

La selezione √® rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

Title: Data Scientist Analyst
Description:
Company Description.

Moviri started as a research spinoff at Politecnico of Milan and was incubated at its startup accelerator.

Data and experimentation are part of our DNA: it is for this reason that we continuously focus on research, emerging ideas, and new technologies, routinely partnering with top academic and engineering research institutions.

Moviri Consulting is the first company of Moviri and its foundation. Moviri‚Äôs professionals use data, software, and insights to solve substantial business challenges for Fortune 500 corporations, multinational banks, global media conglomerates and some of the most respected brands in a variety of industries. The Moviri Consulting Performance Engineering team optimizes performance of IT systems to make them responsive, infinitely scalable, reliable, resilient and cost-effective.




Job Description.

As a Junior Data Scientist in the Moviri Consulting Analytics team, you will be involved in a project related to:

Have the ability to work autonomously, solve complex data science problems, design and code scalable, maintainable solutions.
Leverage machine learning and statistical methods to develop, train, optimize, and evaluate models in the areas of Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Generative AI.
Own the process of data collection, extraction, and aggregation from various sources using main Big Data paradigms, ensuring data is properly formatted, synthesized, and validated for accuracy.
Deploy AI models and systems into production environments, ensuring smooth integration with existing infrastructures and workflows.
Enhance algorithms and models for optimal performance, efficiency, and reliability in real-world applications.




Full-time position at the Milan Office on Hybrid Mode.




Qualifications:

If you share our passion for consulting in the Data & AI field and possess the following characteristics, we are waiting for you:

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, Physics or STEM related field;
Experience on software development and programming (e.g., Python, C++, Java, R); experience on Data Science libraries (Pandas, Scikit Learn, Keras, TensorFlow, Matplotlib, fastAPI);
Familiarity with GIT, AGILE methodology, and Continuous Integration and Delivery;
Familiarity with data management and related languages/tools, database programming in SQL and NoSQL;
Familiarity with Cloud Platforms (e.g. AWS, GCP, or Azure) and Big Data Domains (e.g. Hadoop, Spark);
Familiarity with Cloud Orchestration tools to automate deployment, scaling, and management of containers (e. g. Kubernetes) and containerization technologies (e. g. Docker);
Passionate about development of Machine Learning models (e.g. Time Series Analysis, Clustering, Classification, Anomaly Detection), Computer Vision, NLP, and Generative AI.




Compensation & Benefits

Make a Real Impact joining Moviri: we're on the lookout for dynamic individuals who want to be a driving force in their field, making a significant difference from day one.
Flexibility and Trust: from the moment you step in, you're not just an employee, but you're part of the team of talented colleagues. Moviri value freedom and responsibility, giving you the autonomy to excel and contribute your best in Hybrid mode
Competitive Salary and Company Welfare: Your hard work deserves recognition! Enjoy a competitive salary that reflects your skills and dedication. As a part of our team, you'll also receive a company welfare package of ‚Ç¨600, useful for fuel, bills, as well as wellness and well-being!
Sustainability: in our office, you will always have access to fresh fruit thanks to Cortilia. In Moviri, we are committed to connecting conscious customers with local products and producers, all while prioritizing environmental and social responsibility.
Tech Your Way: choose your weapon in the tech battle! Whether you're team Mac or team Windows, we believe in equipping you with the tools that spark joy. After all, the only thing better than coding your next big idea is doing it on a laptop that suits your style!




Join our team

We cannot realize any of our ambitions or achieve any of our goals without the right talent. If this sounds like you, please apply now. It may be the start of your next chapter!

Title: Data Platform Specialist ‚Äì Stage
HTML:
Societ√†

Banca Mediolanum

Data Platform Specialist ‚Äì Stage

Banca Mediolanum √® un'organizzazione che ridefinisce il panorama finanziario con oltre tre decenni di innovazione. Attraverso le societ√† che ne fanno parte, si dedica a fornire servizi finanziari, bancari e assicurativi su misura che rispondano alle esigenze uniche di ogni cliente.

La Banca si impegna a costruire relazioni durature basate sulla fiducia, trasparenza e sull'attenzione ai dettagli.

La nostra √® una realt√† dinamica, fondata su relazioni, responsabilit√† e libert√†. La nostra cultura promuove la positivit√†, la responsabilit√† e l‚Äôinnovazione sostenibile.

Siamo convinti che il successo di un'azienda sia il risultato del successo individuale dei suoi membri. In Gruppo Mediolanum ti offriamo pi√π di un lavoro: l'opportunit√† di contribuire a un cambiamento positivo e di crescere insieme a noi.

Per la Direzione ICT stiamo cercando una figura di Data Platform Specialist ‚Äì Stage.

Nel team Data Platform e Business Intelligence la risorsa entrer√† in stage e sar√† responsabile delle seguenti attivit√†:


  • Contribuire al team di sviluppo tecnologico e funzionale della Data Platform aziendale, in linea con i principi di Data Governance e Data Quality richiesti dalle normative del settore;
  • Collaborare all‚Äôanalisi e alla documentazione dei requisiti funzionali per l‚Äôevoluzione delle soluzioni applicative del mondo dati, dalla raccolta (Data Injestion) alla presentazione (reporting, dashboarding e data-services);
  • Contribuire alle attivit√† progettuali, dalla raccolta requisiti, all‚Äôanalisi tecnico/funzionale, al supporto alla progettazione, sviluppo e roll out in produzione;
  • Interagire con gli utenti di business, con le altre funzioni interne alla Divisione ICT e con i fornitori esterni, coinvolti nelle attivit√†;


Requisiti:


  • Lauree in Ingegneria, Informatica, Statistica o equivalente;
  • Conoscenza di base ed interesse per il settore bancario e assicurativo;
  • Familiarit√† con i requisiti normativi relativi ai temi di Data Governance (BCBS 239, Bankit 285, GDPR, ecc‚Ä¶);
  • Forte interesse per l‚Äôanalisi dei dati e familiarit√† con le tematiche di Data Management (Glossario Business, Dizionario dei Dati, Data Lineage, Data Quality) e Data Analytics;
  • Buone capacit√† di problem solving, team working, comunicazione, proattivit√†, attitudine analitica e attenzione e cura dei dettagli;
  • Conoscenza avanzata Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project), conoscenza di base di SQL e strumenti di BI;
  • Esperienza accademica o personale con linguaggi di programmazione per la gestione dei dati (Python, Spark, SQL);
  • Conoscenza di strumenti cloud (Azure √® un plus);


Cosa offriamo:


  • Servizio navetta da/per Milano Famagosta (M2) / San Donato Milanese (M3);
  • Hybrid-work;
  • Formazione continua su tecnologie e metodologie avanzate nel campo della Data Platform e dell‚ÄôIntelligenza Artificiale;
  • Possibilit√† di crescita professionale in un team innovativo e dinamico;
  • Coinvolgimento in progetti sfidanti, con impatto strategico per l'azienda;


Sede di lavoro:


  • Basiglio ‚Äì Milano 3 City;

E‚Äô possibile visionare l‚Äôinformativa di Banca Mediolanum SPA, accedendo al seguente link: https://www.bancamediolanum.it/privacy/candidature.

Title: Data and Reporting Analyst
HTML:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.



Data and Reporting Analyst


We report on the evolution of LOIM‚Äôs Financials (Assets under Management, Revenues and Costs) to various internal and external stakeholders. We manage LOIM‚Äôs revenue processes and implement LOIM‚Äôs transfer pricing policies. We provide Financial Planning and Analysis to LOIM‚Äôs business lines and to the Lombard Odier Group.


YOUR ROLE

  • Develop, maintain and run workflows that prepare data and ensure data quality for facts and dimensions feeding our dashboards and reports;
  • Collaborate with our internal data providers (IT, Operations, Business Dev) in projects, production and troubleshooting;
  • Produce, maintain and upgrade dashboards, reports and ad-hoc analysis intended for Senior Management, Investment teams, Business Development;
  • Participate to the preparation of Revenue forecasts;
  • Drive various projects, e.g. improvement of existing data management processes, design dashboards that address new business requirements, integrate new data sources;


YOUR PROFILE

  • 3-5 years of experience in a similar role;
  • Experience working with large datasets and building reports for various stakeholders
  • Strong technical skills, including experience with Alteryx and Tableau, Microsoft office (Excel/Access, VBA), Cognos ReportNet a plus;
  • Genuine interest for the financial industry and investment products;
  • Technically minded and detail oriented with strong conceptual and problem solving skills;
  • Organized, ability to progress on multiple concurrent tasks with autonomy;
  • Team player with good communication skills;
  • Very good written and spoken English and French;
  • Residence in Switzerland.



Our Maison‚Äôs DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.


As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison‚Äôs DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.


It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

Title: Data Analyst (f|m|d) (80-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid Work
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG

We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.

Job Description

Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.

About The Position


Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools


Qualifications

What we are looking for


3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks
Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence
Fluency in English mandatory
German is a plus


Additional Information

Why you should join us

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you‚Äôll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.

Benefits You‚Äôll Love


Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
Hybrid work set-up
40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-ap√©ros, and regular company-wide events
Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
Gender-neutral fair-pay
18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)


Ready to make an impact?

Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

About Us

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people‚Äôs lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).

The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobili√®re and General Atlantic.

Disclaimer

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Description du poste :



CONTEXT:

L‚ÄôOccitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
Support brands including L‚ÄôOccitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins
Support the deployment of Power BI solution



HOW YOU CAN FIT:

Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
A first professional experience in Data Analytics is preferred¬†
Proficiency in Excel and Power BI
Fluent in English and French
Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline




STARTING DATE:¬†July 2025 for 6 months (full-time position)

LOCATION:¬†Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

Title: Internship - Data analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you‚Äôve got big plans ‚Äì so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people‚Äôs lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

Start date: July 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Aubonne, Switzerland

Your Role


Collect and analyze data for various products or services offered by the company.
Contribute to creating performance reports and dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AERA
Support the business to creating dashboard that allow the identification of trends, patterns, or anomalies that might indicate issues or opportunities for improvement.
Resolve technical and functional issues on existing dashboards.
Interact cross-functionally and capture user requirements and business needs to provide dashboards and increase efficiency for various internal stakeholders.
Participate in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions to develop skills and knowledge.
Provide training and help end-users learn how to use the dashboards.


Your Profil


Currently pursuing a master‚Äôs degree in business administration, computer science or related field and willing to learn about the healthcare industry
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, AERA and Knowledge in SQL database and experience with cloud platforms are strong pluses.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and passion for innovation, business development, and entrepreneurship and strong work ethic, self-starter, and team player
Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, with additional language skills like French are considered advantageous


What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe that this variety drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of a team that is dedicated to Sparking Discovery and Elevating Humanity!

Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of a team that is dedicated to Sparking Discovery and Elevating Humanity!

Title: Business Insight Analyst
Description:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.





Job Description



We are looking for a Business Insight Analyst to join our Ancillaries & Strategy team in Chiasso. This is a great opportunity to apply your analytical skills and contribute to improving business performance through data-driven insights.



The candidate will be primarily involved in the Ancillaries area, focusing on pricing strategies, customer segmentation, and market behavior analysis. The role involves supporting development teams with data and insights, helping to shape product roadmaps and enhance the group‚Äôs digital assets.



The candidate will also have the opportunity to present findings to senior management, gaining valuable exposure to strategic decision-making and C-level stakeholders.







The job in brief:



Job Title - Business Insight Analyst



Working model - Chiasso, hybrid



Team - you will join the Ancillaries & Strategy team within the Operations - Platform department.



Level - Professional



Location - Chiasso



Contract - Permanent, full time (36 h/week)







What your impact will be



Analyzing big data, determining customer trends and delivering insight to drive business performance
Closely partner with Product team, driving decision making and strategy with data and analytical insight
Executing multiple projects across teams to successfully achieve specific goals and objectives
Implementing strategies and defining models to accelerate and optimize revenue growth


Qualifications



Your expertise:



1-3 years of experience in Data/Business analyst role in a fast-paced environment
Proven experience of delivering value thanks to data-driven analysis
Excellent knowledge of Excel and SQL programming language
Fluency in English both written and verbal
Ability to influence decision-makers through presentation of analysis

Desirable:



Familiarity with digital and e-commerce business
Previous experience in the travel industry


Additional Information



Perks of working with us:



How we work together:



- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)



- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays



- Flexible start and end of the working day



- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations



How we learn together:



- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.



- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O‚Äôreilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.



Other perks:



- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes



- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues



- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares



- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)



Wish you were here? We do, too!



Selection process steps*:



- HR interview (10-30 minutes)



- 1st interview (Manager)



- Offline Tech test



- 2nd interview (Manager + team member): Test review



- Offer extended

(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)



Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging



At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.



Eligibility criteria:

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

Title: Logistics Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Hiring: Data Analyst (Remote ‚Äì Based in Switzerland)

Are you passionate about turning data into insights that drive smarter decisions? We‚Äôre looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support data-driven strategies and uncover meaningful trends‚Äîall from a fully remote position based in Switzerland.

Location: Remote (Must be based in Switzerland)




What You‚Äôll Do

‚Ä¢ Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and business opportunities

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define KPIs and reporting needs

‚Ä¢ Provide actionable insights to support product, marketing, finance, and operations

‚Ä¢ Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability across sources

‚Ä¢ Support ad hoc analysis and decision-making with clear, data-backed recommendations




What We‚Äôre Looking For

‚Ä¢ 2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role

‚Ä¢ Proficient in SQL, Excel/Google Sheets, and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker)

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Python or R is a strong plus

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and critical thinking skills

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills and ability to present data clearly to non-technical audiences

‚Ä¢ Fluent in English; German or French is a plus

‚Ä¢ Based in Switzerland and authorized to work remotely




Why Join Us

‚Ä¢ 100% remote flexibility with a Switzerland-based team

‚Ä¢ A data-driven culture that values insights and evidence-based decisions

‚Ä¢ Opportunities to shape analytics strategy and influence key business outcomes

‚Ä¢ Collaborative, curious, and growth-oriented team environment

Ready to make data work harder‚Äîand smarter? We‚Äôd love to hear from you.

#DataAnalyst #RemoteJobs #SwitzerlandJobs #HiringNow #DataDriven #BusinessIntelligence #AnalyticsCareers #WorkFromHome

Title: Circularity Data Analyst Intern
Description:
At Nespresso, we believe that we can elevate the world of coffee to drive a positive impact and be a force for good. We place our people at the heart of our success ‚Äì all 14,000 of them. To achieve this, we live by four behaviors. We Inspire, we Care, we Act, and we iNnovate. Want to be part of this exciting journey? Join the Nespresso team- Reimagine what coffee can be. Reimagine what you can become.

Position Snapshot

Location: Vevey, Switzerland

Company: Nespresso HQ

Act. Rate: Full-Time

Type of contract: Internship, 6 months

Start date: Mid-July 2025

Deadline for applications: May 19th

What We Offer At Nespresso

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration

A culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging where individuality is celebrated, and you can be the real you!

Quality and sustainability at the core of who we are and a critical vision of driving positive change

The opportunity to be part of a B Corp certified company and one of the world‚Äôs most trusted brands

Don‚Äôt hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

As a Circularity Data Analyst Intern, you will support data collection and analysis related to material usage and waste generation in our operations. You will assist in identifying data sets, analyzing material flows, creating visualizations, and researching industry benchmarks. This internship provides valuable experience in sustainability practices and data analysis within a collaborative team.

A Day in the Life of a Circularity Data Analyst Intern


Assist in identifying and sourcing relevant data sets on material usage and waste generation within operations and factories.
Support data collection efforts by collaborating with team members to ensure accurate information.
Help analyze material flows to identify basic trends and patterns in usage and waste.
Create simple visualizations (charts, graphs) to present findings to the team.
Assist in proposing basic metrics for measuring circularity, such as material recovery rates.
Contribute to the process of updating and reporting on circularity metrics as needed.
Research industry benchmarks for circularity and summarize findings for team review.
Observe and learn about best practices from industry leaders to support improvement initiatives.


What Will Make You Successful


Student or fresh graduate in a Bachelor Master‚Äôs Degree in Data Science, Business Administration, Economics, or Sustainability
Passion and interest in Sustainability
Strong analytical mind, comfortable with data, curious and autonomous
Excellent presentation skills as well as a methodical and rigorous approach to tasks
Ability to navigate challenges effectively while maintaining a proactive and positive attitude.
Consolidated experience on Sharepoint and PowerBi would be a plus as well as a solid experience with Excel
Fluent in French and advanced-level English proficiency


Nespresso is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

At Nespresso, we‚Äôve built a culture of care and inclusion, making sure everyone can be their bold selves, while growing with the company. We innovate, dare to try, learn and scale up in a fast paced, digital and connected environment. With a diverse workforce made up of over 90 nationalities across 58 countries, you can be a part of an innovative culture, where supportive people help each other. One where anyone is encouraged to challenge the status quo and have an impact on the future for one of the biggest sustainable companies. Whatever your role, you‚Äôll find you can drive real change and spread your enthusiasm. Join the place where you can thrive, you feel, you belong, you are inspired to be and do your best.

Title: Client Consulting Analyst, Visa Consulting and Analytics
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description



What it's all about ...



Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) is the consulting arm of Visa, and drives tangible, impactful results for clients. Drawing on our expertise in consulting, data analytics, digital marketing and economics, VCA solves the most strategic problems for our clients.







Specific Responsibilities include:



Support a team of experienced professionals in delivering strategic consulting services to key Visa clients.



Complete detailed analysis on client data and identify preliminary trends and themes in the data with some guidance.



Conduct market research and data analysis to identify insights in the payment industry.



Support the development of client-specific presentations by adapting templates for unique client scenarios and needs.



Support senior consultants in developing and delivering high-quality advisory solutions to clients, such as business strategy, product development & pricing, customer segmentation and customer experience improvement.



This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 3 set days a week (Tuesday - Thursday), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.‚ÄØ









Qualifications



What we'd like from you ...



Payment industry, digital payments or payment processing experience preferred.



Strategic and analytical thinking with a strong attention to detail that leverages multiple sources of information.



Able to understand and start to disaggregate problem statement into distinct pieces of analysis.



Use and adapt templates for unique client scenarios, optimizing structure to demonstrate + articulate key messages.



Ability to execute quantitative & qualitative analysis with some guidance.



Basic takeaways from the data + starting to craft storyline; ensure data quality + leverage data to support decision-making in project management.



Strong team player with a willingness to collaborate across levels and functional experts.



Strong multi-tasking skills and ability to adapt.



Proficient and ideally a power-user of spreadsheet and presentation tools.



An interest in learning advanced analytics tools (SAS, R, Tableau, etc.).



An interest in payments, financial institutions or consumer lending a plus.



An affinity for payments technology, FinTech and digital.



‚Ä¢ Fluent English and German, both written and spoken (C2 level minimum)





Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Data Science Internship / Working Student
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

For our Web- & eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.

As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as; data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

Example Assignments


Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
Recommendation/ranking algorithms for eCommerce platform
Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss


What We Offer


Dynamic and fun team
Multicultural environment
Working with senior tech leads
Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)


Qualifications

Basic understanding of:


at least one programming/scripting language
database technologies and a query language
data engineering and science basics


Soft Skills


Willingness to learn
Enjoyment of problem solving
English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage


Additional Information

For insights into what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to your direct online application.

Title: Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst

Our company in Schachen employs a diverse group of highly skilled scientists, engineers, technicians, and process specialists from more than 15 nations and provides an important contribution to our company‚Äôs endeavor to bring new innovative medicines to patients as fast as possible, while applying highest quality standards to all activities.

Are you a highly talented biotechnology graduate seeking for a first or new challenge where you are free to take initiative? Would you like to experience working in one of the biggest multinationals in the pharmaceutical industry? We are looking for a graduate student in the field of Biotechnology/Bioinformatics, Data Science or a related discipline, who is searching for a challenging early career position in our innovative company. This role is part of our Future Career Graduate Program which consists in 1 year project-based contract.

Graduate Project

The Schachen Biotech Process Automation team is providing a strategic link between our early and late-stage pipeline and responsible to develop and maintain a ‚ÄòLine of Sight‚Äô between the stages.

The Data Analyst Graduate Project will consist in creating an innovative solution for finding and visualizing correlations between multiple sets and levels of real production process and analytical data. Implementation of PowerBI dashboards for visualization of real time data, focused on representing the key process parameters, key metrics and visualization of out-of-range values for the batches or campaigns. As an extended implementation, creating PowerBI Dashboards to represent a contextualized real time data from SAP (Bill Of Materials, Bill Of Parameters, Inventory) and MES data (Parameter Value Lists) for an overview and possible de-bottlenecking of the Batch/Campaign running.

This will also include working with intelligent automation solutions using AWS and Azure cloud capabilities and tooling, implementation of Power BI dashboards representing the process data and as well possibility of implementation of machine learning algorithms as well as Python or R programming.

As a graduate you should bring energy, knowledge, innovation to carry out the following


Collaborating with various business teams in an international setting to generate business understanding and identifying relevant data sources.
Assess the process and analytical data, collect, clean, and interpret the data available.
Prepare data for analysis and representation in PowerBI Dashboards.
Providing a fresh perspective within the department your opinion matters.
Participate and actively learn about Digital Transformation initiatives involving system integrations, data connectivity and value-based optimization of manufacturing via process supporting analyzation.


The above-mentioned responsibilities are an indication of what you will be doing after proper onboarding and initial learning and development. This provides you with the opportunity to learn and hereafter perform tasks independently. In consultation with your supervisor or peers, you could take on additional tasks and responsibilities.

What Skills You Will Need

In order to excel in this role, you will more than likely have


A graduate student in Biotechnology, Bioinformatics, Data Science.
Passionate about Process Data Science and Data Analysis.
Proven experience in bioprocess engineering, analytical methods, and process data interpretation.
Basic knowledge in Python and/or R.
Basic knowledge in Power BI, Databricks, or Dataiku is preferred but not required.
You are searching for a program where you have the freedom to take initiative.
Effective oral / written communication skills in English.


What We Offer

Being an intern at our company means you will work together with a team on healthcare in an international environment. As a student, you will get the opportunity to develop yourself. In addition, we offer


The possibility to gain experience within the pharmaceutical industry.
The chance to show your potential.
A challenging and dynamic work environment with lots of space to develop yourself.
Professional guidance by an experienced specialist.


What We Look For

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another‚Äôs thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace

Current Employees apply HERE

Current Contingent Workers apply HERE

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme LLC, Rahway, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Employee Status

Intern/Co-op (Fixed Term)

Relocation

No relocation

VISA Sponsorship

No

Travel Requirements

No Travel Required

Flexible Work Arrangements

Not Applicable

Shift

Not Indicated

Valid Driving License

No

Hazardous Material(s)

N/a

Job Posting End Date

05/27/2025


A job posting is effective until 11 59 59PM on the day BEFORE the listed job posting end date. Please ensure you apply to a job posting no later than the day BEFORE the job posting end date.

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Systematic Quantitative Researcher - Entry/Junior Level - London/Paris/Zurich Office Locations




My client is a leading quantitative hedge fund with offices across Europe, North America and Asia. Their teams trade all traditional asset classes and cover a mix of MM/HFT, Stat Arb, Quant Macro, and Event-Driven strategies. The firm is looking for Junior Quantitative Researchers to be responsible for end-to-end strategy research. This is an excellent opportunity for PhD and Master‚Äôs graduates with a background in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a related field.




Successful candidates will work in a collaborative environment where they will gain exposure to the full research pipeline from the front office while working with developers and traders to optimize, implement, monitor and manage strategies.




The Role:

Collaborate with other quantitative researchers and developers to clean datasets, discuss research, and optimise systematic trading strategies.
Involvement in all aspects of the strategy research/trading pipeline, from research based on large datasets to the development, backtesting and monitoring of strategies in live trading.




Requirements:

The ideal candidate will have a Master's or PhD in a numerate field of study, such as Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering.
Excellent coding ability in at least one language. Previous successful candidates are proficient users of Python, C++, Java, MATLAB, etc.
Experience/knowledge of finance from academic studies, internships or professional work.
Strong attention to detail, excellent problem-solving abilities, and the ability to work well in a collaborative environment.

Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist
Description:
Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist

Location: Basel (Hybrid working)

Length of Contract: 7 months




Haybury have partnered with a leading global pharmaceutical organization within Switzerland who are seeking a talented Content Insight and Taxonomy Specialist to generate actionable insights to marketing campaigns alongside providing accurate dashboards and reports for business decision making.




This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual familiar with using systems such as Veeva supporting the analytics and growth frameworks for the digital content, ensuring accuracy and integrity is maintained on each activity.




Responsibilities:




Drive the development and rollout of dashboards that measure content performance across multiple brands and markets
Build and maintain scalable content tagging frameworks aligned to business needs
Lead taxonomy design and expansion to support new channels and campaigns
Support onboarding of global stakeholders as new brands/countries join the program
Collaborate with cross functional data teams and platform teams (e.g., Veeva Vault) to ensure data and system readiness
Facilitate continuous feedback loops to extract insights and guide strategic improvements
Contribute to training programs and documentation to support consistent adoption across teams







Qualifications:




Experience in content strategy, insights, or digital marketing analytics
Strong understanding of tagging, metadata, and taxonomy best practices
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
Familiarity with enterprise content platforms (e.g., Veeva Vault) is a plus
Excellent collaboration skills across business and technical teams







Reach out to Rory.pitts@hayburysearch for a confidential discussion an further insight to the position.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas Markets




Location: Geneva, Switzerland




Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.




About Our Client

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.




The Role

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.




Key Responsibilities

Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
Collaborate with research and consulting teams




Required Qualifications

Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills in English; German proficiency is a plus




What Our Client Offers




An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.




For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.

An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.


For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Pflegewegweiser ‚Äì Essentielle Entlastung f√ºr pflegende Angeh√∂rige

Pflegewegweiser entlastet pflegende Angeh√∂rige schnell und sp√ºrbar ‚Äì in einem System, das oft langsam reagiert. Warten ist f√ºr uns keine Option.

Was uns ausmacht: Wir liefern aussergew√∂hnlich gute Hilfe f√ºr Familien ‚Äì schnell, pers√∂nlich und wirksam. Geschwindigkeit ist unser Werkzeug, radikaler Fokus unser Antrieb. Wir erh√∂hen Standards konsequent, streichen alles Unn√∂tige und vereinfachen das Wesentliche. Dabei handeln wir unternehmerisch: mutig, pragmatisch und l√∂sungsorientiert und genau das erwarten wir auch von Dir.

Wenn du beim Lesen innerlich denkst: Let‚Äôs go ‚Äì schneller, besser, weiter, dann bist du bei uns richtig.

Deine Aufgaben


Entwicklung und Optimierung von SQL-Abfragen in Databricks zur Erstellung t√§glicher Reports und Forecasts
Analyse operativer Spitex-Daten zur Erkennung von Trends, Engp√§ssen und Optimierungspotenzialen
Automatisierung von Datenprozessen mit Python
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Management, Pflegeleitung und Tech-Team
Kontinuierliche Steigerung der Betreuungs- und Prozessqualit√§t durch datenbasierte Transparenz und Fokus auf das Wesentliche


Fachliche Anforderungen


Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Erfahrung mit Databricks SQL oder vergleichbaren Plattformen
Fundierte Python-Skills, insbesondere f√ºr Datenanalyse & Automatisierung
Grundverst√§ndnis relationaler Datenbanken und Umgang mit strukturierten Daten
Erste Erfahrung mit Daten (Beruf, Studium, Projekte) ‚Äì auch motivierte Berufseinsteiger*innen willkommen
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Zeitreihen, Forecasting oder KPI-Tracking
Gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. B1) sowie grundlegende Englischkenntnisse zur Verst√§ndigung mit weiteren Abteilungen


Was Dich Erwartet


Eine sinnstiftende Aufgabe mit echtem gesellschaftlichem Impact
Ein Team mit Tempo, Fokus und Umsetzungskraft
‚ÄûSpeed is King‚Äú ‚Äì Kultur statt B√ºrokratie
Verantwortung und Gestaltungsspielraum


Ready f√ºr Tempo mit Sinn?

Dann freuen wir uns √ºber deine Bewerbung!

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst
Description:
CLEEVEN, a technology consulting firm, was built on two strong convictions:

The excellence of European engineers must ensure global competitiveness

Our human mission: to support our employees in their personal development.




As part of a strategic project with one of our Swiss clients in the pharmaceutical sector, we are recruiting a Data Scientist / Data Analyst (M/F) with a background in life sciences (pharmacy, biology, medical devices...) to support the teams in the collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data related to the development of new components and medical devices.




Role and responsibilities:

Work closely with R&D, clinical, and quality teams to structure and analyze data from preclinical and clinical studies
Analyze health-related data (efficacy, tolerance, side effects‚Ä¶) to support medical and regulatory decision-making
Design statistical or machine learning models to extract insights from domain-specific data
Ensure data quality: cleaning, structuring, and documentation of datasets
Build dashboards and reports to communicate results to non-technical stakeholders
Contribute to the preparation of technical documentation for regulatory submissions




Expected skills:

Excellent command of data analysis tools: Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn...), R, or SAS
Strong understanding of regulated environments (GxP, pharmacovigilance, medical devices...)
Experience working with biomedical or clinical databases
Knowledge of data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, matplotlib, etc.)
Ability to translate complex analytical results into actionable insights for medical or regulatory teams
Experience in pharma, biotech, or medtech environments is a strong plus




Profile:

Engineering degree, Master‚Äôs or PhD in pharmacy, biostatistics, data science, or related field
Prior experience in data science or analytics applied to healthcare
Strong analytical skills, scientific rigor, and autonomy
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work cross-functionally (medical, data, IT teams)
Fluent in English, German and French are a big plus
Valid administrative situation to work in Switzerland




See you soon,

Title: Data Analyst Intern at Operations Performance Management & Development (limited 3-12 months, 40-100%, all genders)
Description:
Operations Performance Management & Development is right at the heart of SWISS‚Äô operations, contributing every day to insights-based decision making and continuous performance improvements of our airline operations. This is a unique opportunity to gain experience not only data analysis, but also airline operations.

Starting date: July 01, 2025, or upon agreement.

You may apply in English or German.

Tasks

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating an impact with tangible business improvements? Then join our SWISS Operations Performance Management & Development team and apply your data skills to actual business challenges shaping SWISS‚Äô journey towards a truly data-driven company!

As a Data Analyst Intern you take a front-seat role in advising SWISS‚Äô operations management. You will support running data projects, ad-hoc analysis, and have the chance to get a glimpse of how we use and enhance the operational data landscape of a global airline.


Provide valuable data-driven insights supporting decision-making within SWISS‚Äô Operations & Steering team
Create data visualizations, reporting, and interactive dashboards
Create insightful analysis to help quantifying key drivers to optimize SWISS‚Äô operational performance
Contribute to our operational data landscape & support automation
Foster data democratization and self-service capabilities across the company
Collaborate and effectively communicate data insights across various stakeholders from SWISS Operations departments


Benefits


Company health management
Discounts
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Remote working (e.g. from home)
Flight benefits
Subsidized parking or public transport
25 days of annual vacation
Diversity programmes
Employee and networking events


Requirements


Workload Specification: For this position, a 100% workload is preferred
Data science and/or data engineering background is an advantage
HF diploma, Bachelor‚Äôs, Master‚Äôs students or graduates (HF diploma & Bachelor‚Äôs students must have completed at least three semesters) in an analytical subject, e.g., data science, engineering, economics, statistics, mathematics or related fields
Knowledge in SQL coding, good command of at least one programming language (R or Python preferred)
Ability to work independently, yet a team-player with strong communication, and social skills
Excellent oral and written presentation skills; competences in analysis and management presentations
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially PowerPoint, and Excel
Fluent knowledge of English is required; knowledge of German will be an additional asset


For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Marius Gisler

recruiting.services@swiss.com

Title: Business Intelligence Data Warehouse Consultant
Description:
Position Title: BI & DWH Specialist

Functional Area: Information Technology

Reporting to: Director - IT

Location: Lugano ( On-Site )

Job Description:

As a BI & DWH Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our Oracle data warehouse and business intelligence solutions. You will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Warehouse Design and Development:
Design and implement a robust data warehouse architecture.
Skill-set Oracle Data Integrator, Oracle Warehouse Builder, Oracle BI Suite, Oracle Database, Oracle Business Intelligence Suite Enterprise Edition, OR OBIEE, PL/SQL, UNIX
Good knowledge of data warehouse designs, including top-down, bottom-up, and hybrid designs.
Develop ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.
Ensure data quality and consistency through data profiling and cleansing techniques.
Technology expertise includes in-depth skills in designing and developing applications with Oracle Technologies.
Good knowledge of PL/ SQL programming, creating Stored Procedures, Functions, Triggers, cursors, and packages.
Proficiency in Software Development Life Cycle SDLC and AGILE development process methodologies, such as requirement analysis, definition, prototyping, proof of concept, designing, coding, testing, and implementation.




Business Intelligence Development:
Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to provide insights into key business metrics.
Collaborate with business users to understand their reporting needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Create data visualizations that are easy to understand and interpret.
Data Analysis and Reporting:
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.
Prepare regular and ad-hoc reports to support decision-making.
Provide data-driven insights to improve business performance.
Data Governance:
Establish and maintain data governance policies and procedures.
Ensure data security and privacy compliance.
Monitor data quality and accuracy.

Qualifications and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Experience in data warehousing and business intelligence, and experience working with globally distributed technology teams. Handled multiple roles: Team Lead, Data Warehouse Developer, Business Analyst, Data Modeler, and Back-End Developer.
6+ years of experience in data warehousing and business intelligence.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques.
Experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, and data mining techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.




Technical Skills:

ETL

Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Oracle Warehouse Builder, PL/ SQL scripts.

Databases

Oracle 8i/ 9i/ 10g/ 11g, Sybase Version ASE 15, SQL Server.

Reporting

Oracle BI Suite, Cognos Reporting, and Actuate Reporting.

Version Control

Visual Source Safe 6.0, Clear Case.

Other Tools

Toad, SQL Navigator, Microsoft Visio, Excel, Rapid SQL, SQL Advantage, HP Service Desk, SQL Developer.

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Why Join Us

The Ermenegildo Zegna Group is one of Italy‚Äôs most famous family driven enterprises and a world leader in luxury menswear. Founded in 1910, Zegna is deeply grounded in history and craftsmanship, yet always at the forefront of contemporary innovation and style.

We are pioneers who embrace change, take ownership of our actions and work to create the world we want.

With over 500 points of sale and 7,000 employees worldwide, we‚Äôre as proud of our people as our products and look for others that share our passion and commitment to excellence and authenticity.

Your Opportunity

Location: Stabio (20% smart working)

As an IT Business Analyst, you will be a member of the Planning and Consolidated application maintenance and development services support team, and you will focus your responsibilities on projects and application maintenance aimed at users located in all areas of the world where the Zegna Group operates.

How Will You Contribute

  • Technical support on Planning and Consolidation applications and resolution of related problems;
  • Implementation of evolutions on systems and/or coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Drafting of the technical specifications necessary for the evolution and maintenance of the systems;
  • Coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Support to users in the testing and training phases for the start-up and use of new features and new applications;
  • Technical support for users and resolution of related problems;
  • Management of relationships with internal customers.

Who You Are

You are a professional with strong data analysis and team working skills, with experience understanding business processes and mature project management skills.

You Have

  • Degree in Economics or Engineering or Computer science (or similar);
  • At least 3 years of experience in similar roles in the IT function of structured companies and/or consultancy companies;
  • In-depth knowledge of the SAP BPC system (knowledge of the main EPM tools will be considered a plus);
  • Fluency in spoken and written Italian and English;
  • Willing to travel.

Title: Data Engineering Intern
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineering Intern in Z√ºrich, where you will have the opportunity to learn from experienced professionals and contribute to innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this internship, you will gain hands-on experience with modern data technologies and help set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

What to Expect in Your First 6 Months

Month 1-2


Get familiar with Sika‚Äôs data architecture, technology stack, and main data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign).
Shadow team members to understand daily workflows and best practices in data engineering.
Support the team with basic data extraction, data entry, and documentation tasks.
Get certified in different technologies such as Azure, Databricks and dbt.


Month 3-4


Learn to use key data engineering tools such as Azure Databricks, dbt, and Azure Data Factory through guided tutorials and hands-on exercises.
Assist in maintaining and updating simple ETL/ELT pipelines under supervision.
Help monitor data quality and perform basic data validation checks.


Month 5-onwards


Support teammates in preparing data for analytics and reporting use cases.
Help create and update documentation, templates, and user guides for data processes.
Participate in troubleshooting sessions and learn how to resolve common data pipeline issues.
Continue to build your skills by attending internal workshops and collaborating on small-scale data projects with guidance from mentors.


Qualifications


Recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, or a related field; Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
Strong interest in data engineering and analytics; relevant coursework or project experience is a plus.
Familiarity with programming languages such as SQL and Python; knowledge of PySpark or dbt is an advantage.
Interest in cloud platforms and services (e.g., Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory); prior experience is a plus but not required.
Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub is a plus.
Eager to learn about domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Fluency in English; proficiency in additional languages is a plus.


Additional Information

To find out what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to receiving your direct online application.

Jetzt bewerbenWas ist dir bei der Arbeit wichtig? Mitgestaltung? Selbstverwirklichung? Sinn? Ausgleich? Herausforderung? Das alles bekommst du bei Mobility. Deine Aufgaben


Du bist im Bereich Kundensegmente f√ºr den Aufbau und die Weiterentwicklung von Kundennutzungs- und Performanceanalysen zust√§ndig.
Du erkennst und analysierst Muster in der Nutzung und entwickelst einen algorithmischen Zuteilungsraster in Kundensegmente anhand erkannter Merkmale (z.B. Nutzungsvorlieben, demografische Merkmale etc.).
Du entwickelst Methoden und Instrumente zur Abbildung von Kennzahlen, Trends und Prognosen in Zusammenhang mit den Kundensegmenten.
Du erstellst (Entscheidungs-) Grundlagen f√ºr die Entwicklung und Optimierung von Massnahmen (z.B. Kampagnen, Usability- oder Produktanpassungen etc.) zur zielgerichteten Bearbeitung der Kundschaft.
Du schaffst die Grundlagen zum Monitoring der Wirksamkeit einzelner Massnahmen (Measure ‚Äì Learn).
Du verantwortest die datenorientierten Analysen und Monitorings des Produkt-Kunden-Fits und Integration der Erkenntnisse in Methoden und Prognosen.
